englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	the	night	when	it	covers
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	ki	qasam	jab	chhāye

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	day	when	it	shines
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	din	ki	jab	chamke

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	One	Who	created	the	male	and	the	female.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	ki	jis	ne	nar	wa	māda	banāye

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	One	Who	created	the	male	and	the	female.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	ki	jis	ne	nar	wa	māda	banāye

englishTranslationText: Indeed	your	efforts	differ.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	tumhāri	koshish	mukhtalif	hai

englishTranslationText: So	for	one	who	gave	and	practised	piety
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	jis	ne	diyā	aur	parhez-gāri	ki

englishTranslationText: And	believed	the	best	matter	to	be	true
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	sab	se	achchi	ko	sach	mānā

englishTranslationText: So	We	will	very	soon	provide	him	ease.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	bahut	jald	ham	usey	āsāni	muhayyā	kar	deñge

englishTranslationText: And	for	him	who	hoarded	wealth	and	remained	carefree,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	jis	ne	bukhl	kiyā	aur	be	parwāh	banā

englishTranslationText: And	denied	the	best	matter,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	sab	se	achchi	ko	jhutlāyā

englishTranslationText: So	We	will	very	soon	provide	him	hardship.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	bahut	jald	ham	usey	dushwāri	muhayyā	kar	deñge

arabicText: وَمَا يُغْنِى عَنْهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ
englishTranslationText: His	wealth	will	not	avail	him	when	he	falls	into	ruin.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	us	kā	māl	usey	kām	na	āaye	gā	jab	halākat	meiñ	pade	gā

englishTranslationText: Indeed	guiding	is	upon	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	hidāyat	farmānā	hamāre	žimme	hai.

englishTranslationText: And	indeed	the	Hereafter	and	this	world	both	belong	to	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	ākhirat	aur	duniyā	donoñ	ke	hamiñ	mālik	haiñ

englishTranslationText: I	therefore	warn	you	of	the	fire	that	is	ablaze.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	maiñ	tumheñ	darātā	huñ	us	āg	se	jo	bhadak	rahi	hai.

englishTranslationText: None	except	the	most	wicked	will	enter	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Na	jāye	gā	us	meiñ	magar	badā	bad	bakht.

englishTranslationText: The	one	who	denied	and	turned	away.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	ne	jhutlāyā	aur	muñh	pherā

englishTranslationText:
He	will	be	far	away	from	the	most	pious.	
(The	first	Caliph	S.	Abu	Bakr	Siddiq)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	bahut	jald	us	se	door	rakhā	jāye	gā	jo	
sab	se	badā	parhez-gār.

englishTranslationText: Who	gives	his	wealth	in	order	to	be	pure.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	apnā	māl	detā	hai	ke	suthrā	ho

arabicText: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعْمَةٍۢ تُجْزَىٰٓ
englishTranslationText:
And	no	one	has	done	a	favour	to	him,	for	
which	he	should	be	compensated.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kisi	kā	us	par	kuch	eḥsān	nahiñ	jis	kā	
badla	diyā	jāye

englishTranslationText:
He	desires	only	to	please	his	Lord,	the	
Supreme.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Sirf	apne	Rab	ki	riza	chāhtā	jo	sab	se	
buland	hai

englishTranslationText: And	indeed,	soon	he	will	be	very	pleased.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	qareeb	hai	ke	woh	rāzi	ho	gā.

englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	the	late	morning,
romanUrduTranslationText: Chāsht	ki	qasam

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	night	when	it	covers,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	ki	jab	parda	dāle.

englishTranslationText:
Your	Lord	has	not	forsaken	you	nor	does	
He	dislike	you!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ke	tumheñ	tumhāre	rab	ne	na	chordā	aur	
na	makrooh	jānā.

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	the	latter	is	better	for	you	than	
the	former.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	pichli	tumhāre	liye	pahli	se	
behtar	hai

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	your	Lord	will	soon	give	you	so	
much	that	you	will	be	pleased.	(Allah	seeks	
to	please	the	Holy	Prophet	–	peace	and	
blessings	be	upon	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak	qareeb	hai	ke	tumhārā	Rab	
tumheñ	itnā	de	gā	ke	tum	rāzi	ho	jāoge.

englishTranslationText:
Did	He	not	find	you	an	orphan,	so	provided	
you	shelter?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	us	ne	tumheñ	yateem	na	pāyā	phir	
jagah	di

englishTranslationText:
And	found	you	deeply	engrossed	in	His	
love,	so	directed	you?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumheñ	apni	muḥabbat	meiñ	khud	
rafta	pāyā	to	apni	ṭaraf	rāh	di

englishTranslationText: And	found	you	in	need,	so	made	you	prosperous?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumheñ	ḥājat	mand	pāyā	phir	ghani	
kar	diyā

englishTranslationText: Therefore	do	not	oppress	the	orphan.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	yateem	par	dabāo	na	dālo

englishTranslationText: And	do	not	rebuke	the	beggar.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	mangtā	ko	na	jhirdko

englishTranslationText: And	abundantly	proclaim	the	favours	of	your	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	apne	Rab	ki	ne’amat	kā	khob	charchā	karo

englishTranslationText: Did	We	not	widen	your	bosom?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kyā	ham	ne	tumhāre	liye	seena	kushāda	na	kiyā

englishTranslationText: And	relieve	you	of	the	burden	–
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tum	par	se	tumhārā	woh	bojh	utār	liyā.

englishTranslationText: Which	had	broken	your	back?
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	ne	tumhāri	peeth	todi	thi

englishTranslationText: And	We	have	exalted	your	remembrance	for	you.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	ne	tumhāre	liye	tumhārā	žikr	buland	kar	diyā

englishTranslationText: So	indeed	with	hardship	is	ease.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	be-shak	dushwāri	ke	sāth	āasāni	hai.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	with	hardship	is	ease.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	dushwāri	ke	sāth	āasāni	hai	.

englishTranslationText: So	when	you	finish	the	prayer,	strive	in	supplication.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jab	tum	Namāz	se	fārigh	ho	to	du’ā	meiñ	meḥnat	karo

englishTranslationText: And	incline	towards	your	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	apne	Rab	hi	ki	ṭaraf	raghbat	karo.

englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	the	fig	and	of	the	olive,
romanUrduTranslationText: Injeer	ki	qasam	aur	zaitoon

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	Mount	Sinai,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Toor-e-Sinā

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	this	secure	land,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	is	amān	wāle	shahar	ki

arabicText: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ فِىٓ أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
We	have	indeed	created	man	in	the	best	
shape.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	Ham	ne	āadmi	ko	achchi	soorat	
par	banāyā

englishTranslationText:
We	then	turned	him	towards	all	the	lowest	
of	the	low	states.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	usey	har	neechi	se	neechi	si	ḥālat	ki	
ṭaraf	pher	diyā

arabicText: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Except	those	who	accepted	faith	and	did	
good	deeds	–	for	them	is	an	infinite	reward.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Magar	jo	Imān	lāye	aur	achche	kām	kiye	ki	
unheñ	be-ḥad	sawāb	hai

englishTranslationText:
So	after	this,	what	causes	you	to	deny	the	
judgement?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	ab	kyā	chiz	tumjhe	insāf	ke	jhutlāne	par	
bā’is	hai

englishTranslationText:
Is	not	Allah	the	Greatest	Judge	upon	all	
judges?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	Allāh	sab	ḥākimoñ	se	badh	kar	ḥākim	
nahiñ?

englishTranslationText:
Read	with	the	name	of	your	Lord	Who	
created,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Pardho	pane	Rab	ke	nām	se	jis	ne	paidā	
kiyā

englishTranslationText: Created	man	from	a	clot.
romanUrduTranslationText: Āadmi	ko	khoon	ki	phatak	se	banāyā.

englishTranslationText:
Read,	and	your	Lord	only	is	the	Most	
Beneficent,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Padho	aur	tumhārā	Rab	hi	sab	se	badā	
karim.

englishTranslationText: The	One	Who	taught	to	write	with	the	pen.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	ne	qalam	se	likhnā	sikhāyā

englishTranslationText:
The	One	Who	taught	man	all	what	he	did	
not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ādmi	ko	sikhāyā	jo	na	jāntā	thā

englishTranslationText: Yes	indeed,	man	is	surely	rebellious.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	be-shak	āadmi	sarkashi	kartā	hai

englishTranslationText: As	he	considers	himself	independent!		.
romanUrduTranslationText: Is	par	ke	apne	āp	ko	ghani	samajh	liyā

englishTranslationText: Indeed	towards	your	Lord	only	is	the	return.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	tumhāre	Rab	hi	ki	ṭaraf	phirnā	hai

englishTranslationText: What	is	your	opinion	–	regarding	him	who	forbids	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhalā	dekho	to	jo	man’a	kartā	hai.

englishTranslationText: A	bondman	when	he	offers	the	prayer?
romanUrduTranslationText: Bande	ko	jab	woh	Namāz	padhe

englishTranslationText: What	is	your	opinion	–	if	he	were	upon	guidance,
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhalā	dekho	to	agar	woh	hidāyat	par	hotā.

englishTranslationText: He	would	enjoin	piety,	so	how	good	it	would	be!
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	parhezgāri	batātā	to	kiyā	khoob	thā.

englishTranslationText: What	is	your	opinion	–	if	he	denies	and	turns	away,	how	wretched	will	be	his	state!
romanUrduTranslationText: Bhalā	dekho	to	agar	jhutlāyā	aur	muñh	pherā

arabicText: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمْ يَنتَهِ لَنَسْفَعًۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
englishTranslationText: Did	he	not	realise	that	Allah	is	watching?
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kyā	ḥāl	hogā	kyā	na	jānā	ke	Allāh	dekh	rahā	hai

englishTranslationText: Yes	certainly,	if	he	does	not	desist,	We	will	seize	him	by	the	forelock.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	agar	b’az	na	āayā	to	ham	zaror	peshāni	ke	bāl	pakad	kar	kheeñcheñ	ge

englishTranslationText: A	forelock	that	lies,	is	sinful.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kaisi	peshāni	jhooti	khaṭā	kār.

englishTranslationText: So	let	him	now	call	his	gang!
romanUrduTranslationText: Ab	pukāre	apni	majlis	ko
